author: Rich Foster
title: T0 Intraday Liquidity Management
description: to settle liquidity transactions intraday using available options such as repo, commercial paper and margin.

assessments.note: This seems targetted at a small number of large financial institutions, not Cardano end users. Not clear it meets the challenge goal of providing the most value for end users in 2021.

The proposal represents a big use case for blockchain and stablecoins. We would love this kind of institutional use of Cardano. However the idea feels premature considering the current state of Cardano.
This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: DApps & Integrations Challenge.
This is targeted at large financial institutions. These are all developing there own solutions. None of these are mentioned in the plan. How will this get taken up?

The proposer clearly understands the business  in question, but it is less clear that they understand the blockchain technology to execute it with.  There is no clear roadmap or timeline.  I think the proposal needs more refinement.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented but needs more details on the team members. 
Do you plan to hire a team? How many by when?

No detail on how this would get accepted by large financial institutions who are developing there own solutions. It is not clear it addresses the challenge. Even if it was successful it would take more than this year to get accepted. and it focusses on large financial institutions. Whereas the challenge is "What applications will provide the most value for end users in 2021?"

only 5k in funds is requested for what appears to be a very ambitious project. There are no timelines, roadmaps or metrics for success provided. it is unclear how the funds would be allocated or what products we can expect.

The Roadmap is missing. This proposal needs more details on the step-by-step action plan, including milestones and KPI'S. 
 When do you plan to release the product?  Who will build this project?

solution: Atomic settlement of cash transactions using automated "smart contract" programs.

20 years of financial service sales and operations experience at Citi, JP Morgan
